result.execSummary:
The defendant Luke James Blackley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:04 P.M., Defendant Luke James Blackley in court, in custody with attorney David Karpe.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel has received PSI, A.F. makes statement, Court sentences defendant to Ct. 2: 4 years prison, 2 years initial confinement, consecutive to any other sentence, 2 years extended supervision, Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program, 1:55 P.M.

Cases called: 14CF393, 15CF220 & 15CF438, Defendant Luke James Blackley in court with attorney David Karpe. Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court went over the rights & elements. Court explained read in and dismissed to the defendant. Defendant pled guilty to count 2 in 15CF220.  Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, ordered a PSI to be done. Count 1 read in and dismissed. 14CF393 & 15CF438 read in and dismissed. Argued sentencing to be set once PSI received.

David Karpe

Defendant Luke James Blackley in court, in custody with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lawton requested to withdraw.  Defendant would like new counsel.  Defendant feels atty has not helped him.  Court set for preliminary hearing.  State had no objection to new counsel.  Court will grant request.  Public defender is to reappoint atty.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Luke James Blackley appeared by video with Atty Leonie Dolch.   Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint received, reading  waived.  Court imposed $2500.00 signature bond.  Time limits waived.  PTC with ADA Long 7-8-15 @ 2:00 PM; return hearing 7-29-15 @ 2:45 pm.
